borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions:
<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">The use hereby permitted
shall be discontinued and the land restored to its condition at the time of
granting this planning permission on or before 28 September 2026 in accordance
with a scheme of work submitted to and approved by the Local Planning
Authority.</span><i><o:p></o:p></i></p>
<p class="MsoNormal">The proposed development shall be constructed in accordance with materials and colors annotated on the approved drawings.&nbsp;</p>

<p>Prior to first occupation of the development hereby permitted,&nbsp; four Sheffield Stand in line with the London Cycling Design Standards providing space for at least eight bicycles shall be provided and made available in full and retained in perpetuity of the development.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>

<p class="MsoNormal">a) The development must be fully implemented in accordance
with the remediation and verification strategy set out in report,
"Remediation Statement”, reference 1045-CGL-S2N-207B-RP-XX-Y-COOP, prepared by CGL, dated March 2021.</p><p class="MsoNormal">b) Following completion of the measures identified in report
"(in part (a)), a verification report that demonstrates the effectiveness
of the remediation carried out must be submitted to and approved in writing by
the Local Planning Authority.</p><p>







</p><p class="MsoNormal">c) In the event that contamination is found at any time when
carrying out the approved development of extent and magnitude greater than that
previous identified it must be reported in writing immediately to the Local
Planning Authority. An investigation and risk assessment in accordance with
current best practice and where remediation is necessary a remediation scheme
must be prepared in accordance with current best practice.<o:p></o:p></p>

<p>The car parking management
strategy for the management of parking within the development site, shall be implemented and carried out solely in accordance with Section 4.3.12 of the&nbsp;<span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">Transport
Statement – Temporary Co-Op Store (BRL-WSP-COP-XX-XX-RP-D-0001) prepared by WSP
dated July 2021.</span><br></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom:0cm"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif"><o:p></o:p></span></p>

There shall be no means of vehicular and pedestrian access to the development
other than as shown on the approved drawings.&nbsp;<br>

<p>Deliveries, servicing and routing for the
development shall be carried out solely in accordance in Section 4.5 "Deliveries and Routing" of the Transport Statement&nbsp;<span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">–
Temporary Co-Op Store (BRL-WSP-COP-XX-XX-RP-D-0001) prepared by WSP dated July
2021;&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">Delivery vehicle tracking (</span><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">drw no.&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">BRL-WSP-COP-XX-XX-DR-D-9201
Rev P02); and&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">Delivery Route (drw no.&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">BRL-WSP-COP-XX-XX-DR-D-9202
Rev P02).</span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal">The proposed development hereby permitted shall trade between the hours of 07:00
and 23:00 on any day and at no other time.</p><p class="MsoNormal"><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class="MsoNormal">The delivery/collection of goods
associated with the non-residential use hereby permitted shall only be
permitted to take place between the hours of 07:00 and 21:00 on any
day.</p>

<p>The development hereby permitted relates to the site edged red on "<span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">Location and site plans (dwg no.&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">PP100 Rev C)"</span>, and it shall only be carried out within the site in
accordance with the approved documents and plans referred to below:</p><p><u>Drawings</u></p><ul><li style="margin-bottom: 0cm;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">PP100
Rev C (Location and site plans)<o:p></o:p></span></li><li style="margin-bottom: 0cm;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">PP101
Rev H (Proposed location and site plans)<o:p></o:p></span></li><li style="margin-bottom: 0cm;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">PP102
Rev I (Proposed ground floor plan)<o:p></o:p></span></li><li style="margin-bottom: 0cm;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">PP103
Rev H (Proposed roof plan)<o:p></o:p></span></li><li style="margin-bottom: 0cm;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">PP104
Rev H (Proposed elevations A &amp; B)<o:p></o:p></span></li><li style="margin-bottom: 0cm;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">PP105
Rev G (Proposed Elevations C, D &amp; E)<o:p></o:p></span></li><li style="margin-bottom: 0cm;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">BRL-WSP-COP-XX-XX-DR-D-0200
Rev P07 (General arrangement)<o:p></o:p></span></li><li style="margin-bottom: 0cm;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">BRL-WSP-COP-XX-XX-DR-D-0100
Rev P05 (Proposed Utility Layout)<o:p></o:p></span></li><li style="margin-bottom: 0cm;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">BRL-WSP-COP-XX-XX-DR-D-1200
Rev P06 (Setting out and proposed levels)<o:p></o:p></span></li><li style="margin-bottom: 0cm;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">BRL-WSP-COP-XX-XX-DR-D-5200-P01
Rev P05 (Proposed Drainage Layout)<o:p></o:p></span></li><li style="margin-bottom: 0cm;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">BRL-WSP-COP-XX-XX-DR-D-7200
Rev P06 (Paving and kerbing)<o:p></o:p></span></li><li style="margin-bottom: 0cm;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">BRL-WSP-COP-XX-XX-DR-D-9200
Rev P03 (Car Entry Tracking)<o:p></o:p></span></li><li style="margin-bottom: 0cm;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">BRL-WSP-COP-XX-XX-DR-D-9201
Rev P02 (Delivery vehicle tracking)<o:p></o:p></span></li><li style="margin-bottom: 0cm;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">BRL-WSP-COP-XX-XX-DR-D-9202
Rev P02 (Delivery Route)<o:p></o:p></span></li><li style="margin-bottom: 0cm;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">BRL-WSP-ZZZ-XX-XX-DR-D-5303
Rev P06 (Surface water drainage strategy Sheet 1)<o:p></o:p></span></li><li style="margin-bottom: 0cm;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">BRL-WSP-ZZZ-XX-XX-DR-D-5304
Rev P05 (Surface water drainage strategy Sheet 2)</span></li><li style="margin-bottom: 0cm;"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">BRL-WSP-ZZZ-XX-XX-DR-D-5302
Rev P06 (Foul drainage strategy)</span></li></ul><p style="margin-bottom: 0cm;"><u>Documents</u></p><p style="margin-bottom: 0cm;"><br></p><ul><li style="margin-bottom: 0cm;">Cover letter (ref: 21896/A3/POF) prepared by Barton Willmore, dated 23 July 2021<span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif"><ul></ul>







</span></li><li style="margin-bottom: 0cm;">Letter
from Co-Op Group&nbsp;</li><li style="margin-bottom: 0cm;">Planning
Statement prepared by Barton Willmore, dated July 2021<o:p></o:p></li><li style="margin-bottom: 0cm;">Remediation statement (<span style="font-size:11.0pt;line-height:107%;
font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;mso-fareast-font-family:Calibri;mso-fareast-theme-font:
minor-latin;mso-ansi-language:EN-GB;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;mso-bidi-language:
AR-SA">1045-CGL-S2N-207B-RP-XX-Y-COOP</span>) prepared by CGL, dated
March 2021<o:p></o:p></li><li style="margin-bottom: 0cm;">Transport
Statement – Temporary Co-Op Store (BRL-WSP-COP-XX-XX-RP-D-0001) prepared by WSP
dated July 2021 <o:p></o:p></li><li style="margin-bottom: 0cm;">Drainage
and Utility Statement prepared by WSP dated 22 July 2021<o:p></o:p></li></ul><p><br></p><p>No other drawings or documents apply unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp;</p>

<p class="MsoNormal"><span lang="EN-US">Noise from the development hereby
permitted, shall be controlled so as to be inaudible inside adjoining and other
noise-sensitive premises in the vicinity of those uses. The initial test for
compliance with the ‘inaudibility’ criterion will be that noise should be no
more than barely audible outside those noise-sensitive premises. In the event
there is disagreement as to whether such noise is or is not audible the
following numerical limits shall be used to determine compliance with this
condition:</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:14.2pt;text-indent:-14.2pt;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo1;
text-autospace:none"><!--[if !supportLists]--><span lang="EN-US" style="font-family:
Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:Symbol;mso-ansi-language:
EN-US">·<span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-stretch: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span><!--[endif]--><span lang="EN-US">the
LAeq (CUAN) shall not exceed LA90 (WCUAN); and<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:14.2pt;text-indent:-14.2pt;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo1;
text-autospace:none"><!--[if !supportLists]--><span lang="EN-US" style="font-family:
Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:Symbol;mso-ansi-language:
EN-US">·<span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-stretch: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span><!--[endif]--><span lang="EN-US">the
L10 (CUAN) shall not exceed L90 (WCUAN) in any 1/3 octave band between 40Hz and
160Hz.</span></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span lang="EN-US">CUAN = Commercial/Community Use Activity Noise
Level, WCUAN = representative background noise level without commercial/community
use activity noise, both measured 1 metre from the façade of the
noise-sensitive premises.<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="line-height:115%"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal">The combined rating level of the
noise from any plant installed pursuant to this permission (other than plant
which is only to be operated in emergency circumstances) shall not exceed the
existing background noise level outside the window to any noise-sensitive room.
Any assessment of compliance in this regard shall be made according to the
methodology and procedures presented in BS4142:2014.<o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal">Any machinery and equipment
installed pursuant to this permission shall be designed and installed to ensure
that structure borne (re-radiated) noise emissions shall not exceed 35 LAeq dB
(5 min) when measured in any habitable room in adjoining residential premises.</p>

<p class="MsoNormal">a) Prior to occupation the development hereby permitted, details of any ventilation system for the removal and
treatment of cooking odours from any commercial catering, including its
appearance and measures to mitigate system noise, are to be submitted to and
approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp; The measures shall have
regard to and be commensurate with guidance and recommendations in:</p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:14.2pt;mso-add-space:auto;text-indent:
-14.2pt;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo1"><!--[if !supportLists]--><span style="font-family:
Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-language:
EN-US">·<span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-stretch: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span><!--[endif]-->The
current edition of publication '“Specification for Kitchen Ventilation
Systems”, DW/172, Heating and Ventilating Contractors Association, or other
relevant and authoritative guidance; and<o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:14.2pt;mso-add-space:auto;text-indent:
-14.2pt;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo1"><!--[if !supportLists]--><span style="font-family:
Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-language:
EN-US">·<span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-stretch: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span><!--[endif]-->Publication,
“Control of Odour and Noise from Commercial Kitchen Exhaust Systems – Update to
the 2004 report prepared by NETCEN for the Department for Environment, Food and
Rural Affairs”, Ricardo.com, 2018.</p><p class="MsoNormal">b) The approved details shall be
fully implemented before the first use of the relevant non-residential unit and
shall thereafter be permanently retained in an efficient manner.</p>

<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 14px; font-family: &quot;PT Sans&quot;, sans-serif; color: rgb(51, 51, 51); background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">The development hereby permitted shall proceed in accordance
with the submitted Flood Risk Assessment prepare by Ardent (reference L2815-01),&nbsp; dated September 2021 and Drainage and Utility Statement prepared by WSP, dated 22 July 2021.&nbsp;</span><o:p></o:p></p>
description: Construction of a single storey retail unit (187 sqm GIA) with associated parking and landscaping for a temporary period limited to five years from the grant of permission.
